news_header: The B.CS Group meeting in Kazan concludes today with discussions involving Russian President Putin and U.N. Secretary General Guterres.
news_text: The B.CS Group, hosted by Russia and its neighboring countries, is ending its meeting today in Kazan. President Vladimir Putin is expected to speak with U.N. Secretary General Antonio Guterres, whose attendance has faced criticism for allegedly breaching the United Nations Charter due to his visit related to WWII. The B.CS Group's goal is to establish a competing alternative to the current international system and institutions, which they view as overly influenced by Western powers.
